songs.description: my favorite song from this album. i think my favorite part is the crescendo at fake plastic love. the stress builds up to a wonderful crescendo. (12/2/2023)

songs.embed: <iframe style="border-radius:12px" src="https://open.spotify.com/embed/track/1dyTcli07c77mtQK3ahUZR?utm_source=generator" width="100%" height="352" frameBorder="0" allowfullscreen="" allow="autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; fullscreen; picture-in-picture" loading="lazy"></iframe>
songs.description: this song is just plain fun. the acoustic synthesizing with the ever-heightening electric solos make me want to whip about erratically. the solo at the very end? the best part. (12/3/2023)

albumtitle: mr. morale and the big steppers

songs.embed: <iframe style="border-radius:12px" src="https://open.spotify.com/embed/track/346SJSEbB6pNZMpwovxDiu?utm_source=generator" width="100%" height="352" frameBorder="0" allowfullscreen="" allow="autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; fullscreen; picture-in-picture" loading="lazy"></iframe>
songs.description: a long, somber tale about generational trauma that exponentially builds to an explosive and freeing ending. lamar recognizes coping mechanisms and frees himself from the trauma that plagued him for years, breaking a generational curse. this song feels like a weight being lifted from my shoulders, like my past is forgiven. powerful. (12/2/2023)

songs.embed: <iframe style="border-radius:12px" src="https://open.spotify.com/embed/track/5xoYormSTltk6F9SlQV6mm?utm_source=generator" width="100%" height="352" frameBorder="0" allowfullscreen="" allow="autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; fullscreen; picture-in-picture" loading="lazy"></iframe>
songs.description: really, this whole album is great (as well as his discography in general), and i think this song is the culmination of his healing process. with lines like "personal gain off my pain is nonsense", and "i choose me, i'm sorry", this song feels bittersweet, like i'm saying goodbye to what i know but i know it's for the better. a great way to wrap up the album. (12/2/2023)
